videoSnippet.title: And This Isn't Even Hikaru's Immortal!
videoSnippet.description:
Hikaru's Immortal Game https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IABVWQTAN9M
Search all my videos easy https://agadmator-library.github.io/
Join our Telegram channel here t.me/agadmatorChannel (https://t.me/agadmatorChannel)
Join our Telegram group here t.me/BarAndTheLibrary (https://t.me/BarAndTheLibrary)

Wesley So vs Hikaru Nakamura
"Black Knights Matter" (game of the day Feb-10-2016)
Sinquefield Cup (2015), St Louis, MO USA, rd 6, Aug-29
King's Indian Defense: Orthodox Variation. Classical System Traditional Line (E99)

1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 Bg7 4. e4 d6 5. Nf3 O-O 6. Be2 e5 7. O-O Nc6 8. d5 Ne7 9. Ne1 Nd7 10. f3 f5 11. Be3 f4 12. Bf2 g5 13. Nd3 Ng6 14. c5 Nf6 15. Rc1 Rf7 16. Kh1 h5 17. cd6 cd6 18. Nb5 a6 19. Na3 b5 20. Rc6 g4 21. Qc2 Qf8 22. Rc1 Bd7 23. Rc7 Bh6 24. Be1 h4 25. fg4 f3 26. gf3 Ne4 27. Rd1 Rf3 28. Rd7 Rf1 29. Kg2 Be3 30. Bg3 hg3 31. Rf1 Nh4 32. Kh3 Qh6 33. g5 Ng5 34. Kg4 Nhf3 35. Nf2 Qh4 36. Kf5 Rf8 37. Kg6 Rf6 38. Kf6 Ne4 39. Kg6 Qg5#

00:00 Hello Everyone!

The 3rd Sinquefield Cup was played in the Saint Louis Chess Club and Scholastic Center, Missouri USA, 23 August - 1 September 2015. It was this year the second of three events of the new Grand Chess Tour. The nine regular tour players were joined by wildcard Wesley So for a single round robin. Tournament director: Tony D Rich. Overall prize fund: $300,000, with $75,000 to the winner, and down to $15,000 for 10th place. Players received 120 minutes for 40 moves, 60 more minutes for the rest of the game, and a 30-second delay from move 41. Rounds started at 1 pm. Levon Aronian won with 6/9 and collected 13 Grand Chess Tour pointsglobalchessleague.com
